direction.raw_text: (V.O.) And love slipped the bonds of restraint... At a table under a willow tree sits Tess - early fifties, funky specs - at a laptop. She pauses in her typing, staring at Andy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.)(CONT'D) His touch was like a cosmic `yes'. Underneath a converted barn, cross-legged on a bench in a bikini top, sits Eustacia. She is hunched over a note pad, writing at tremendous speed, oblivious to all but her work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) `Fuck you,' screamed Kelly, `Fuck you to hell!' Scott stepped back from the cell door as the gob of spit flew.'
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. GLEN'S ROOM. 1A Sitting at a barn window is American academic Glen McCreavy ; a physically awkward man, more at home with his intellect than his body. He is surrounded by foolscap, post-it notes, books and markers - dominated by a poster of a dour Victorian - Thomas Hardy. He is writing. GLEN (V.O.) This complex contemporary matrix is what Hardy meant by `the ache of modernism.' He regards it. GLEN Crap. He deletes it. He looks at his blank screen, breathing deeply. The only words left say `Chapter Six'.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Inchcombe had seen it all before. He'd seasoned it: the metallic smell of blood and gunshot; forensics hunched like vultures. The dreadful mundanity of murder, he thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - NICHOLAS' SHED. 3 Nicholas Hardiment writes fluidly with pencil and paper. A good-looking man of fifty. Dark hair, strong figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) He approached Patel, who was stricken. She was one for whom a corpse was still an obscenity. Inchcombe realised a disturbing truth. His lack of feeling was almost... (He stops writing. Sighs)

direction.raw_text: Pathological...
direction.name: direction

Jody Long - fourteen, skinny, restless - is lying at the bottom of the slide gazing at the clouds. Casey Shaw, her shy, placid best friend, is sitting on a toddler toy, reading aloud from a magazine.

direction.raw_text: . DAY. EWEDOWN. OUTSIDE THE PUB. 11A The driver brakes, swerves and comes to a halt. Tamara Drewe gets out. She's twenty eight, startlingly beautiful. She looks around shocked, for the culprit. The immaculate, picturesque street is deserted. Tamara takes it in, with an expression of such distaste that it might as well be a landfill site.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a dump. As she drives away, we see Nadia sitting outside the pub in her urban heels, anxiously smoking a cigarette.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LATE AFTERNOON. WINNARDS FARM. 12 Tamara drives up to an old farmhouse. She gets out of the car and stands at the gate. Air of neglect; dark windows. Tamara looks at the place as if it stirs memories. She doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LATE AFTERNOON. WINNARDS FARM. 14 At the back of the house Tamara walks through an overgrown, neglected garden. She peers through the back door into the kitchen. A thin layer of dust on the surfaces; a sense of recent abandonment. Suddenly a pigeon flies out from the porch eaves - just over her head. Tamara startles. It completely spooks her. She backs away. She doesn't know what to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LATE AFTERNOON. EWEDOWN - BUS SHELTER. 13 Jody and Casey are slouched on the bench at the bus stop. Three teenage boys are doing wheelies over the T-junction. One of them almost lands in the shop. An old lady comes out, shoo-ing them away.

direction.raw_text: We could walk up the garage.

I'm always taking you for granted. I'm vile I know; you should kick me really, but - He's about to leave. Beth speaks calmly.

DIGGORY No wonder he's bored. EUSTACIA I hope she takes him to the fucking cleaners. Nicholas walks to his car. Silence. He roars away. 20C INT. EVENING. STONEFIELD - THE KITCHEN. 20C Beth comes into the kitchen. Her eyes flicker over pictures of her daughter and Nicholas. She is in shock.

direction.raw_text: Have that on me. And here's your key. Up the stairs, right in front. You can't miss it. Tamara utters her thanks, surprised at Zoe's kindness. She takes her drink and the key upstairs. Zoe remains, grinning. We see why. Andy Cobb has just walked in. Zoe pulls him a pint.

direction.raw_text: I can do that. Beth... Andy takes the shovel. Beth bites back tears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won't last five minutes. Beth looks down embarrassed by (but grateful for) his support.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD. 26A Glen wanders into Beth's office. The wall in front of him is dominated by a framed newspaper profile of Nicholas, surrounded by framed covers of Inchcombe books. The whole room is a shrine to Nicholas' career. Glen is in the hall looking at Beth's prints and pictures; old maps, wildlife and framed letters from grateful writers who have stayed at the retreat. He stares at a print of farm workers in the nineteenth century. Glen sighs. GLEN (V.O.) I know why I'm drawn to Thomas Hardy. He writes about failure better than anyone else. I need this book to go well. I need a tiny reward for my endeavours... His stomach gurgles ominously. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 17A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I need a dump.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 27 GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 18.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - THE HALL/DOWNSTAIRS CLOAKROOM 28 Glen walks down the corridor by the kitchen, to the downstairs cloakroom; a marvellous Victorian toilet of reassuring size. He shuts the door in relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - THE HALL/DOWNSTAIRS CLOAKROOM. 29 Glen is on the loo. Even in this small room there are framed photographs of Nicholas receiving awards. He looks at them in wonder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) If that's the way you feel... Nadia, I'm devastated. Through the frosted window Glen sees Nicholas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) But if that's your decision, I'll have to learn to live with it. Beth comes in from the garden. Glen sees Nicholas quickly end the call. For Beth's benefit:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Into his phone) I told you. I love my wife. Don't ever phone me again. Glen is shocked by this duplicity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No don't touch me, don't you dare. Glen panics, realising their reunion is going to be right by the door. He puts his hand on the flush, hoping to warn them - too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not good enough. Not any more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You do what you like and then you're sorry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) I hate myself. I hate myself. Glen opens the door a chink. They are feet away from him. Nicholas looks unshaven, shagged and guilty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where were you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Drove her back to London. Took all night.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You drove her home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was in a state.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think she'll get over it?... Nicholas shrugs. To Glen's horror, he starts to cry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. Then Beth is sobbing too. They are in each other's arms, holding each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know why I'm like this. I couldn't do without you. Glen looks away from the clinch, horribly embarrassed. He opens the toilet window, puts the soap dish straight. Looks again - still hugging, sobbing, kissing - puts his hand on the flush - too awful to reveal himself - takes it off again. Straightens his hair, examines his teeth, sweating. He looks again. At last the emotion is abating. Nicholas releases Beth. She wipes her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to go to the bottle bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Let's talk later.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. The goat's come into heat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you so much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too. Beth goes. Nicholas is watching her; his expression strange. He walks away. At last Glen emerges, incredulous at Nicholas' lies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - THE GROUNDS. 31 Glen flops into a sun-lounger near Diggory.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've just seen the Hardiments kiss and make up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hat is on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like she's taking him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When the hat is on, it means don't speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So... Peace is restored. The sound of a burglar alarm suddenly blares over the garden. Diggory sits up, infuriated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELDS (LIMBURY). 32 Glen is following Andy down the hill from Stonefield. The cows are too close for Glen's comfort. He hurries through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like cows. I mean really. They exude bovine malice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, these girls are killing machines. They don't like Americans either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very funny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. FIELD AND COPSE. (LARKHAM) 32A Glen and Andy are in the valley between the two farms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Winnards Farm. Lady there died a while back. Place is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think it's being robbed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Prob'ly just kids. Nothing to do round here except make trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if it's bad guys? Don't you have a blunderbuss or a fowling piece or something? They climb up through a copse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. FIELDS (WINNARDS). 32B Glen and Andy are going up the hill towards Winnards.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Used to belong to my dad, this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it all went tits-up. Land was flogged to a consortium and the house was sold to Londoners; the Drewes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So this is your ancestral pile?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was. Born in that room up there. He points up at the back bedroom window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must have been pretty resentful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. DAY. WINNARDS FARM - THE LANE. 33 An eighteen year old Andy jumps off a stile into the lane behind a slim, fifteen year old girl on a horse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .10.09 21A. The girl turns. She has a huge nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This farm's mine, big nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .10.09 22. The girl kicks the horse into a trot, her nose in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARDS FARM. 34 Andy and Glen turn the corner to the back of the house. Tamara is up a ladder wielding a hammer at the alarm box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, what're you doing? Tamara gives the alarm box a great whack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who are you??
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy, you moron; it's me. Andy looks more closely. A disturbing spark of recognition.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tam?... Hardly recognise you. Another whack. The noise becomes a high-pitched squeal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You won't do it that way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then help me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARDS FARM - THE KITCHEN. 35 Andy turns the alarm off. Tamara enters the dusty kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Used to do bits of work for your mum. Been keeping an eye on the place since she died.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What sort of work, graphics?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do horticulture now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a gardener? Andy says nothing. He stares at her nose. Glen has come in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a great old house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to buy it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not really the property-owning kind. Prefer my life to fit into hand luggage. ANDY That's why you're back, to flog it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Make a nice second home for some banker wankers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy if you want it, why don't you make me an offer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because sadly I'm still prey to the economic forces that threw the peasant classes off the land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unlucky. Tamara opens a cupboard. It's full of empty wine bottles. ANDY Tam. Their eyes meet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the fuck have you done to yourself? Tamara's face falls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELDS (LARKHAM). 36 Glen and Andy are walking back. Andy is brooding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's completely different. GLEN How was she before? What's the story?... GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 24.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There isn't one. GLEN Come on. ANDY Was nothing. Decade ago. Just a teenage thing. 37 1996. INT. DAY. WINNARDS FARM - A SHED. 37 Tamara pulling down her pants; Andy unbuttoning his jeans. She jumps up on the worktable, pushing a stack of turnips out of the way. They kiss passionately.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You should find someone you're in love with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You stupid prick. Andy looks at her. She is sincere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You saying you love me, frosty tits?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You say it; You're the girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck off. She kisses him. As they start to make love:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you. Fuck off. I love you. 37A EXT. DAY. A FIELD. 37A Glen looks over at Andy, interrupting his thoughts. GLEN Romeo and Juliet, huh? Andy carries on down the hill, shaking his head. 38 INT. DAY. WINNARDS FARM - THE KITCHEN. 38 Tamara is watching Andy walk away with Glen. Her eyes follow him curiously - then she firmly turns her back. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 24A. Tamara rips a bin liner off the roll and shakes it out. She takes a deep breath. She opens the cupboard and begins to bin the distressing mountain of empty wine bottles. 39 EXT. NIGHT. STONEFIELD - THE GROUNDS. 39 Beth is standing at the hedge looking down at the valley with Nicholas at her side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thinking of the first time we saw this place...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've made it a wonderful home Beth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not wonderful enough. She starts to walk away. Nicholas holds her back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you can't put this behind you, then we're stuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I'd better sort myself out then. NICHOLAS What has to happen? I am sorry - Beth brings her arm up to push him away. Nicholas catches it; draws her to him. He kisses her insistently. Beth's resistance diminishes. Soon it has gone. We begin to see the depth of Beth's physical love for him. At that moment, Glen walks round the corner. He tries to backtrack, mortified by his intrusion on their passion. Too late. They part. Nicholas turns away in frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just taking the air. Flustered, he knocks into a tub of lobelias. Beth and Nicholas remain. The moment between them is gone. Round the corner, Glen is cringing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. EWEDOWN - BUS SHELTER. 41 Jody and Casey are reading a celebrity magazine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you do him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's gay, you dobbin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? They turn to a big spread on a band called Swipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben Sergeant... I'd walk through fire to do him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The drummer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not just the drummer. He writes the lyrics; it's his band. He's the fucking genius, not Steve Culley or any of these wankers. It's Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . I'd do Ben.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wanna be her, in that dress with him licking my teapot lids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah... me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LATE AFTERNOON. STONEFIELD - THE GROUNDS. 42 Casey is still carrying this image as she serves a tray of nibbles on the patio. She stands among the writers, watching a fly get caught in one of the vol-au-vents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People talk about the muscularity in prose. I want a similar muscularity in my verse. I don't want a poetry that's flabby or obese - that's why I adhere to the tightest rhyme schemes: Diggory picks the vol-au-vent up and without looking, puts it in his mouth. Casey moves over to Nicholas and Glen. DIGGORY ABB ACC DEE D. They give you the armature, the beating heart, the nerve ends... NICHOLAS So has the muse shone on you, Greg?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've been pretty distracted. Most recently by those delicious cookie things that Beth brought round this afternoon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes. Of course we call them biscuits here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And by the place itself, the people.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sometimes wish I could get distracted. Ten page a day man, rain or shine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow, that's scary. Ten pages; how do you do that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, Greg -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wouldn't presume to give an academic tips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Matter of fact I read one of your books. Another distraction but I thought it was decent stuff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well. He's offended.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do I do it? I just get on with it, Greg. Nicholas walks away leaving Glen smarting. The female writers surround Nicholas. He tops them up, full of charm. Under his breath, Glen impersonates:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: `We call them biscuits, here.' Nicholas raises his glass for a toast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To the muse, however you find her. He is looking at Beth. She is gratified. Then his eye shifts, his glass still in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who's that? Tamara Drewe is climbing the stile at the bottom of the garden in a low cut T-shirt, tiny pair of denim shorts and bare feet. The evening light bathes her in a golden sheen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Tamara Drewe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No it isn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I met her with Andy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good God. What's happened to her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's had a nose job, Dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's completely different.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what Andy said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor Tamara. Such a sad girl. She used to come and help you wash the car, didn't she Nicholas? I think she liked a bit of family after her dad left.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that Tamara Drewe who writes the column in one of the Sundays?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Used to. Writes for the Independent now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She spent weeks going on about her nose job. Smart way to pay for it I suppose. Was her old one an awful conk?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's poured herself into those shorts. I hope they don't give her thrush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the etiquette with nose jobs? Do we mention it, or... Tamara has arrived in earshot. Absolutely everyone, including a very curious Casey, is staring at her nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello. Sorry to intrude. Her hand defensively brushes her nose. Poppy walks towards her, full of warmth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Tamara.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poppy, how are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love your new hooter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. It isn't actually new; just smaller...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .10.09 29. At last Beth remembers her manners.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara, so sorry about your mum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you staying down for a while?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll have to. There's so much to be done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You must let us know if we can help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, I was going to ask if you could spare a pair of strong arms. I've got a skip coming tomorrow and -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicholas? - Nicholas is opening another bottle of prosecco. It pops its cork over his trousers. He mutters a swear word.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm available. I do skips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well thank you. You're very kind... Is Andy around at all? Beth is helping Nicholas wipe his trousers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I can't spare Andy. He's making a new coop for my Buff Orpingtons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEXT DAY. WINNARDS FARM. 43 Tamara and Glen are carrying junk out to a skip. Tamara is in big boots and a slightly more practical pair of shorts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - THE KITCHEN. 44 Beth is preparing lunch, talking to Poppy. Nicholas is going through his typed-up manuscript; not really listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's had the writers down there helping her all day. I hope she realises they're here to work... POPPY Can't believe what a difference her nose makes. BETH Well I think it's a mistake; taken away all her character.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on; she looks ten times better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh. BETH And she knows it. I found those shorts really irritating. Going around with half her bum hanging out. I mean, why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To annoy people like you. Might get a pair myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course you won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you're not desperate, are you? Always something a bit desperate about Tamara Drewe. Beth looks at him puzzled as he works on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARDS FARM. 45 Tamara and Glen are having a rest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So why did you change your face?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Changing my face is the best thing I ever did. And I don't care what anyone thinks. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 31.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would it work for me? TAMARA Maybe; if you did the wrinkles too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you're just coming on to me... Tamara laughs. She starts work again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In your column, you write about yourself... Does that come easily? TAMARA No... But it feels right. My first novel's definitely going to be autobiographical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your first novel? You're going to dash one off just like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ideally, I'd like to make it into fiction before I'm thirty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And then maybe a swimwear collection, a chat show, a pasta sauce range?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? GLEN Life sure is easy for the beautiful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know before I got the nose job I had no trouble getting taken seriously. Maybe, when they removed that bit of cartilage, they pulled my brain out by mistake - what do you think? Glen smiles, won over. 46 INT. LATE AFTERNOON. EWEDOWN - THE PUB. 46 Glen is coming from the bar with a pint for Andy and a half for himself. He has just been served by Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's single, man. Andy looks over at Zoe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well it's not exactly a relationship; we just have an occasional thing. Zoe doesn't want to be tied down and -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not Zoe! Tamara... You should get in there. Marry the girl. Then you get to live back in your ancestral home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way. Not her type.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trouble is Andy, you think like a loser. And I know that because I'm the loser that losers turn to for tips. I'm the losers loser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a pedigree loser. I had a graphics business; went bust. And then with my great business acumen I invested in a polytunnel full of ganja.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wow. How'd that go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Made a tit of myself. Spent about six years stoned out of my box and I'm only just getting it back together. Besides, even if I was the last man in the world, Tamara Drewe wouldn't have me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why not?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dumped her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, you are a loser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was twenty. My mates thought I was cradle snatching... And they used to call her Beaky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. DAY. OUTSIDE THE PUB. 47 Tamara in her school uniform, is gutted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beaky?... We see her stricken face as she turns away. Then she turns back and hits Andy. His nose streams blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LATE AFTERNOON. EWEDOWN - THE PUB. 48 Glen is preparing to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You told her the truth... The time might come when she respects that. Andy, as your love guru, I suggest you ask Tamara for a date. But take a shower first, OK?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Piss off, Glen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING. WINNARDS FARM. 49 Tamara is in her shorts and boots, chucking empty bottles and old saucepans into the skip, like an Amazon.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING. STONEFIELD - THE GROUNDS. 50 Nicholas is at the hedge, looking down the valley towards Winnards Farm. He is watching Tamara like a hawk - as if he can't quite believe what he is seeing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EXT. DAY. STONEFIELD - THE GROUNDS. 51 Nicholas and Tamara are polishing Nicholas' car. TAMARA Boys know nothing. Nicholas looks up at her, smiles indulgently. Tamara stops work. TAMARA (CONT'D) I've been reading `Inchcombe's Dose.' NICHOLAS Have you? TAMARA The bit where Doctor Inchcombe finds himself having thoughts about the dead guy's daughter. Tamara walks around the car, bringing her polishing cloth closer to his. TAMARA (CONT'D) You describe her light smattering of freckles and her striking profile. So... She turns her head. TAMARA (CONT'D) Who did you base her on? NICHOLAS What? TAMARA Have you noticed me? Nicholas looks at her in surprise. TAMARA (CONT'D) Because I've noticed you... GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 33A. She waits, hoping for a kiss, a hug, anything. She puts out a hand - almost touches him. He steps back. NICHOLAS Think it's time you went. Tamara is mortified. NICHOLAS (CONT'D) You're making yourself ridiculous. This really hurts. Tamara takes the bucket of soapy water and throws it over the car - and Nicholas. TAMARA Nicholarse. NICHOLAS (CONT'D) Oh, grow up. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 34.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING. STONEFIELD - THE GROUNDS. 52 Nicholas is still staring at Tamara, who is jumping on the stuff in the skip. Glen is strolling up the hill from the pub. He follows Nicholas' gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A man can dream, huh? Nicholas looks at him affronted - as if he doesn't know what he's talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING. WINNARDS FARM. 53 Tamara, hot and dirty, runs up the stairs with her roll of bin liners. She opens the door to her mother's bedroom. She is completely unprepared for it. A neat, womanly room covered in photographs of Tamara as a child, teen and young woman. On the dressing table is a lipstick; the lid lying next to it as if it has just been used. Tamara picks it up. She sits, suddenly exhausted. For the first time, she looks lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. ANOTHER FARM - THE GOAT PEN. 54 Tamara still looks slightly shaken as she walks up to Andy. He is watching Ingrid meet Darcy, a billy goat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go on Ingrid; have some kids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty direct isn't he? He's not even bought her a coke. Andy turns. Sees her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he stinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She doesn't mind; it's like Lynx to her. If she's ready she'll stand for him, if not she won't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's disturbing human.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Refreshing basic. Darcy is up and at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thought you'd have gone back to London by now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish. Looks like I'm stuck here for a while. Actually, I've got a proposition for you. Andy glances at the goats; bad idea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We should go for a drink sometime, Tam. You know, for old times sake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So we can reminisce about how I smashed your nose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't smash it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It just bled. The memory is between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've got to do the house up before I sell it. It looks like an eighties timewarp. Would you like the job? He just looks at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Painting it and tidying the garden? Good hourly rate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It can't be easy down there, Tam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know when to stop! You're an idiot. I'm not having nothing to do with it. Jody shouts over her from /.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Otherwise my whole life'll go by and I'll be washed up and thirty four like my mum and no one decent will ever even have snogged me! Casey is leaving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You twat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck off then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. NICHOLAS' SHED. STONEFIELD. 145 Nicholas is writing. Beth approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's the festival brochure. You're on in the Lanson Marquee. I've marked a few bits in case you want to read. Beth hands him a hardback.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a marvel. Cheers. He kisses her and prepares to leave. She is suspicious. BETH I could come with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, don't. You hate festivals. BETH But it's only Hadditon. I'll come. NICHOLAS It's completely boring. You'll hate it. Stay here. Her suspicion will stay silent no longer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you got anything to tell me, Nicholas?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what? Nicholas attacks; the best form of defence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: God, it's like living with the effing moral police. Are you ever going to trust me? He goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. EWEDOWN (PIG FIELD). 145A Nicholas drives through a huge puddle in his 4X4, splashing Casey. He roars on, oblivious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (getting her mobile out) Right. Wanker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. KITCHEN - STONEFIELD. 149 Glen is admiring his finished manuscript. Beth is making sponge, preoccupied - but pleased at Glen's achievement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm doing this cake in celebration. Well done. Glen holds up his mug of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To Hardy. BETH (TOASTING HIM) Although I can't bear the man for what he did to his wife. Andy comes in with an armful of logs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, things were different then. She had no choice. Beth's mobile bleeps. She picks it up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She couldn't just walk away. I mean who'd put up with that now? Beth drops the mixing bowl. She cannot speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Looking to Andy) How do I find out who sent this? Andy takes the phone, sees the photo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It says number withheld. He returns the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you know? Andy nods guiltily. Beth acknowledges what this means.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Couldn't tell you. I'm sorry Beth. He leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her... Glen looks at the photo; Nicholas and Tamara's clinch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh My God. This is just - this is horrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right under my nose. I feel sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so shitty, so insulting. You do not deserve to be treated -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you're kind to me, I'll cry. I don't want to cry. I must be very clear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there is anything I can do...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have to do it myself. Beth's face cracks into distress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I trod in the sponge mix.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's OK. It's OK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD. ANDY'S CORRUGATED SHED. 150 Tamara is out on a walk. She approaches the shed; sees Andy's landrover parked beside it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy? Andy emerges. Tamara smiles tentatively. TAMARA Hey. How are you? Andy says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to have that drink? I could do with a friend / at the moment and - ANDY You and Nicholas Hardiment. That's a nice piece of work isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .10.09 92. Tamara is utterly dismayed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I get it from his point of view. He's always been a cheating wanker. He loves having his cake and eating it - But since when did your standards drop so low? You could have anyone. All you have to do is bat your eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I care a lot about Beth. She helped me out when I was at rock bottom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not going to split them up. It's
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A bit of fun? Tamara is covered with shame. TAMARA It's none of your bloody business. ANDY I reckoned I could still see the blazing girl you used to be. But now? TAMARA Shut up! ANDY I don't know who you are. She turns away, her eyes stinging. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 93.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. A FILLING STATION. 150A Boss is crapping on a verge. Ben is on his phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That Jody? This is Ben Sergeant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. EWEDOWN - JODY'S BEDROOM. 151 Jody falls off her bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right, yes... I love dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. A FILLING STATION. 151A The crap is done. Man and dog are back in the car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So I'll meet you at Winnards Farm, four thirty. Ben zooms off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. EWEDOWN - JODY'S HOUSE. 152 Jody is haranguing with her mum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a nice dog, Mum!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well I don't like `em. Dog-hair and slobber all over the place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I said yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No dogs, no way and that's final. Jody is devastated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You loser. I hate you. You want to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !!! Jody slams her bedroom door. She stares at herself in the mirror. She steels herself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Live the dream, Jody...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. HADDITON - OUTSIDE THE FESTIVAL MARQUEE. 153 Tamara pulls Nicholas into a quiet corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy Cobb has rumbled us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cock pie. Has he told Beth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. But he might. And I wouldn't blame him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I suppose it has to come out sometime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it? NICHOLAS It's a good thing. Feels like a relief. Means you and I can start to think about our plans. For the future...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicholas?... NICHOLAS I know it's been hard, sharing me with Beth. But I'm yours now. I'm going to leave her. I want a new life - and I want it now. With you. Tamara is appalled. A minder interrupts. MINDER Mr Hardiment? It's time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. HADDITON - THE MARQUEE. 155 During the interview, Tamara takes a seat at the end of the front row. The audience listens attentively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It all runs very smoothly. I start a book in the summer, publish it the following spring. Bit of a factory, really. INTERVIEWER So you've just finished `Like The Night', Inchcombe's seventeenth adventure. Are you already planning the next?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There won't be a next one. Frankly I'm sick to death of Inchcombe. In fact, I'm about to kill him off. There's a gust of dismay in the crowd, as though a real death has been announced.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's a bombshell for your fans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (all for Tamara) Yes, but I'm moving on to fresh pastures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inchcombe will be meeting a very sticky end. And it's one murder I'm really looking forward to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How could you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This might be a good moment to take a few questions. Yes, the lady in the apron...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You write a lot about adultery. Is that from personal experience? Tamara turns round. Nicholas' colour drains. Beth is with Glen, close by - glaring at him. He tries to make a joke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Madam, what a saucy question!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you cheat persistently on your wife? Nicholas considers whether he wants to be publicly humiliated. He decides not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because she lets me. Beth takes this like a blow. Even Tamara is shocked by it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. HADDITON - THE GROUNDS BY THE MARQUEE. 156 Tamara is striding away from the Marquee, red with shame. Nicholas is at her side almost jogging to keep up. TAMARA It's got to stop, Nicholas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're right. I can't go on using her, lying to her. Won't be fun but I've got to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't feel alive with Beth! I haven't been living for years. She's had me smothered in a comfy blanket - TAMARA Nicholas, listen to me. She makes him look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had fun. But it's wrong. And it's over. NICHOLAS But... I'm in love with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry. Nicholas looks as if he's just been punched.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You can't end it. Tamara - Fuck supper!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you keep it down? NICHOLAS My God, you're cold hearted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't shout. NICHOLAS You don't feel a thing, do you? TAMARA I do feel. I feel like I'm blazing away inside all the time. Why do I do these things? What am I doing with you? The question hangs between them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's someone else isn't there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh for God's sake. NICHOLAS Not that narcissist drummer? TAMARA Goodbye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's that ignorant lunk isn't it? That muscle-bound wastrel Andy Cobb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andy Cobb is a far better man than you! In saying it, Tamara realises it's true. She walks away. Nicholas bends almost double in pain, letting out a great moan from the soul. A fan has been waiting at a respectful distance. He approaches. Nicholas numbly takes his book. Instead of signing, he tears it to pieces. He hands the tatters back to the fan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARDS FARM - HALL / TAMARA'S BEDROOM 157 Jody knocks on the door. It's open. She pushes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello? It's Jody Long. About the dog? She looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben? She heads up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARDS FARM - TAMARA'S BEDROOM. 157A GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 98. Jody enters Tamara's bedroom. She stares at the bed. She runs her hand over the cotton percale. She puts on Tamara's slip and looks at herself in the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello Jody... Jody spins round. The door closes. Ben is standing behind it. He is wearing a tight black T-shirt; the man of her dreams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dog minder? I guessed you might be the somebody who's been getting in here, pissing about, sending e-mails and fucking people up. D'you know what I'm saying? You've been breaking in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't break in. Used the key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What key?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Found it under a pot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well for fuck's sake. Did you nick my T-shirt?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Took it as a souvenir. I'm sorry! Jody is very scared. She is crying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Creeping about in our stuff? What gives you the right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just... like I always wanted to meet you...just once...just to tell you stuff...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What stuff?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like... I love you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So that's nice. Least someone does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I used to lie awake thinking about you being here... in Ewedown, the bumhole of nowhere. It was the best thing to happen ever. I've been so in love with you. And when you left I couldn't bear it. I thought the valentine would make you come back...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: D'you still love me, Jody? Even though I wanna lock you up in a young offenders institution? Jody nods, unsure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What would you do for me then? Would you do anything, like a proper fan? Jody looks at him, scared. She manages a nod. Ben approaches her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's see then shall we? We see Jody's phone flashing on the bed. CASEY (V.O.) Jody! What are you doing not fucking answering?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. EWEDOWN. 158 Casey is at the triangle leaving a message on Jody's phone. Boss is running round and round it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben's dog. It's here. Means Ben must be - Casey suddenly realises where Jody is. The dog runs off up the street. Casey sets off towards Winnards, full of apprehension.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - DOWNSTAIRS. 159 Beth is taking Nicholas' awards down and chucking them in a box. Glen is trying to save them from smashing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet that bitch wants a baby. Well she'll find out; Nicholas doesn't do children.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .10.09 99A. She is brandishing a diamond dagger award.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He'll leave it all up to her. That'll age her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But suppose he discovers fatherhood? (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They do, these men, second time round. They get all nappy-happy. I was barely twenty when I got pregnant. I've never done anything! Oh God! God!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes you have. Look at this place!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate him - I've wasted my life! GLEN No... What about all the work you do here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breeding goats? Baking fucking biscuits? It's meaningless! Beth bawls. Glen holds her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth... When I was lost with my book you helped me more than you know. You asked who I was writing it for... He starts to really hold her. The sobbing subsides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You. He kisses her. Beth looks at Glen; a revelation. The future opens up. She kisses him back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. Nicholas is standing in the doorway, looking grey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I speak with my wife? Glen releases Beth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. You may not. She walks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - THE GROUNDS. 160 Beth walks outside towards the chicken coup. Nicholas pursues her. She sees Boss running across the grounds chasing birds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Ben Sergeant's dog. Perhaps he's come to beat the shit out of you - good! NICHOLAS Beth - I finished it. She's been chasing me; this wild crush - BETH LIAR - NICHOLAS There's something desperate about her, something almost unhinged - BETH Good God, even when you try and tell the truth you lie. YOU LIE!! Nicholas is falling apart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want you to leave. I want a divorce. I want Stonefield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth...Don't. You can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will. (TO BOSS) And you - Go home! Bugger Off!! She throws a handful of chicken feed at him. Boss runs away. Beth storms off. Nicholas looks profoundly shocked; like a man who has just realised he's in danger of drowning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARDS FARM. 160A Tamara's car pulls up outside. She gets out, looking at the yellow Porsche in complete disbelief. TAMARA Ben... GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 101A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARDS FARM - THE KITCHEN. 161 Jody is shakily pouring a pot of tea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. Now put two sugars in and stir it. OK. That's a decent cup. Which is lucky Jody cos if it had been shit, I'd be on the phone to the extremely scary local cops right now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please don't tell my mum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew it was boring round here but for fuck's sake...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm gonna get out as soon as I can. Going to work in Vegas - as a croupier. Vegas, or a cruise liner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aim high, that's what I say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARDS FARM. THE HALL. 161A Tamara lets herself in. She calls: TAMARA Ben?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARDS FARM. THE KITCHEN. 161B GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 102.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara. You've had an infestation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jody. Jody, shamefaced, prepares to cough up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. A FIELD. 162 Boss is lolloping round. He stops. The whole herd of cows is staring at him. Boss regards the animals with curiosity. He wags his tail. Will they play? He starts to bark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELDS. 163 Nicholas sees Glen sitting on the edge of an old rusting trough. Fury overwhelms him. NICHOLAS Oy! Greg! I want a a word with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Glen, asshole. Nicholas is stomping through the mud and cowshit. NICHOLAS You fucking devious bastard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm devious? I'm a bastard? NICHOLAS You think I haven't noticed how you've been worming your way in? You keep your hands off my wife, you low-rent pedant. GLEN You've abused her long enough / with your goddamn lies - NICHOLAS I want you out of my house. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 103.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Beth's. She made this place - NICHOLAS And I fucking pay for it. I've given Beth all this. What can you give her? GLE I can give her / integrity! NICHOLAS Obscure literary shit not worth ten PENCE - GLEN You know if I made my pile fantasizing rapes and homicides I wouldn't be so proud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You cunt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you. Glen grabs him round the middle. They struggle like overgrown schoolboys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth'll come to her senses. You need an income to run Stonefield. And mine's bigger than yours! Glen nuts him. Nicholas slips backwards in the mud. He whacks his skull on the sharp, rusting corner of the trough. He falls to the ground. Glen is astonished at his own prowess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now... get up, Nicholas. Let's talk about this like grown men. Blood trickles from the wound on Nicholas' head. He moans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God. Nicholas... Glen becomes aware of a sound like a drumbeat, the drumming of hooves. The herd of cows come over the brow of the hill and down towards them. Boss is chasing them, barking. The beasts are terrified, stampeding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .10.09 104. They are heading straight for the trough. Nicholas is trying to get up on his knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicholas! Get up! Run! Glen puts out a hand to help him. But before Nicholas notices, he instinctively retrieves it. Glen turns on his heels and runs, terrified. He throws himself into the hedge as the cows thunder past. They disappear down the hill, Boss still behind them. Glen looks back towards the water trough. Nicholas is lying on his front, his face pressed into the mud, unmoving. Glen walks over. He gingerly peers at him. The back of Nicholas' skull is broken open. Blood is pooling in the mud and shit. Glen panics. He looks all around. Has the accident been seen? No human is visible. Has his part in it been noticed? He bends down as if to turn the body over, in case by some miracle Nicholas still lives. He cannot bring himself to touch him. Fear overwhelms him. He runs away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARDS FARM - THE KITCHEN / HALL. 164 Tamara is looking at Jody, stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was you? Jody can't look her in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jody has explained that she did it out of deep love for me. To Ben's astonishment, Tamara smiles. He grabs his moment. BEN (CONT'D) Tamara... It's an apology. Tamara takes Ben's hand and leads him through to a dresser in the hall. She opens it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ben. She takes the ring out of the jar and puts it in his hand. TAMARA (CONT'D) I'm in love with someone else. At that moment, Casey appears at the back door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jody - the dog!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELDS. 165 Boss is still worrying the herd. He's got them against a gate. The animals are very distressed. Behind them we see Andy's Landrover appear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELDS (LARKHAM) 165A Andy gets out of his Landrover, takes out his rifle, comes through the gate. Loads his rifle while watching the dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELDS (LARKHAM). 165B His POV. The dog and the cattle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELDS (LARKHAM). 165C He raises the gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELDS (LARKHAM). 165D Through his sights, the dog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELDS (LARKHAM). 165E As his finger tightens on the trigger. Bang. A shot rings out. He looks round, off right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELDS (LARKHAM). 165F Up on the ridge of the hill, Penny Upminster is standing in a straw hat and flowery wellies, with a smoking gun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got `im. The beast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - BETH'S OFFICE. 167 Beth, chucking fan mail into the bin, stops in her tracks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. WINNARD'S FARM. 167A Tamara's head appears at the front door. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 106.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - THE FIELD. 168C Beth is coming down the field where Nicholas lies. She sees a figure in the distance. She squints, the sun in her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. COPSE (LARKHAM'S) 168D Opposite her she sees Tamara descending through the copse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. FIELD. (LARKHAMS) 169 Tamara, walking down by the trough, discovers Nicholas' body. She drops to her knees, light-headed with shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. FIELD. 170 Beth walks into the field. She sees Tamara kneeling, looking at something on the other side of the trough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bitch. Tamara looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth - no -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brazen. That is brazen. Beth carries on walking towards her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth. Don't. Tamara is running towards Beth. She cannot bear her to see. She throws her arms around her, protecting her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't look. Don't look... It is too late. Beth is seeing the corpse. A great wave of shock hits her. Tamara holds her tight, trying to contain it. Another great wave of shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nicholas. No. Her cries of grief soar over the valley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. THE FIELD - LATER. 171 Tamara, ashen, is on the phone to emergency services. TAMARA You'll get to it through Byley farm. His skull is broken. It's smashed. No I haven't but... it's obvious. His wife. Yes she is. Thank you. Thank you. I will. Beth has turned Nicholas over. She is washing the mud from his face with water from the trough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're on their way... Beth seems totally closed off. Tamara gingerly approaches. She touches Beth's shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth? Help is coming - Beth cannot bear to be touched. Her hand involuntarily flies out. It slams into Tamara's face. Tamara steps back. Her nose is broken, pouring blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's broken! - She gasps, riding the pain, knowing she deserves it. It's the biggest wake-up call of her life. Beth stares at her, at first astonished at what she has done - then satisfied. Tamara stumbles away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. IN THE COPSE. LATER. 171A Tamara sits beside a dewpond, gingerly washing the blood off her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tamara... Andy is watching. She turns away from him. He approaches. TAMARA I'm sorry. She starts crying bitter tears. GOLDENROD REVISIONS 20.10.09 107A.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tam, come on. It was an accident. Still Tamara cries. He comforts her. She lets him. He holds her for some time. ANDY I'd better get up to Stonefield. Come with me. We'll get this sorted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .10.09 108. Tamara shakes her head. She separates herself from him and stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then get Ben to take you to London. Make sure he looks after you. Tamara walks a few paces away. She stares straight ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't want to be with Ben. She looks back at Andy. He begins to understand. She walks off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD. GLEN'S ROOM. 171B Glen, sick with dread, is drying his face with a towel. He picks up his muddy shoes and clothes, wraps them in a bag and shoves them in his case. His eyes alight on his poster of Thomas Hardy. He pulls it down. 172 EXT. DAY. WINNARDS FARM - THE GARDEN. 172 Ben and the girls have dug a grave for Boss. Casey is putting flowers on the top. Ben starts to cry like a broken-hearted little boy. Jody instinctively puts her arms round him. The girls are immensely moved. Jody looks over at Casey. She
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pap me! Pap me! Casey waits until Ben is not looking. Then she takes pictures with her mobile phone. Jody cradles Ben in her arms, doing her best moved-but-sultry pose. Casey tries not to laugh. Jody is ecstatic. The man of her dreams is in her arms. Her wish has come true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - THE COURTYARD. 172A An ambulance and two police cars are in the courtyard. The police are carrying the corpse, covered in blankets. Andy crosses the yard to the barn. He bumps into Glen furtively coming out of the door. Glen's case is packed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing? Glen can't look him in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I figured I'd best, you know, take myself off. She doesn't want writers around the place now. And police, autopsies, not my thing -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't run away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not running away! I just finished my book; my time here is up. Destiny calls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth is asking for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's... Really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's on her own over there. Glen, she doesn't need a writer around the place. She needs a man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DAY. STONEFIELD - THE KITCHEN. 175 Beth is sitting, still pale with shock, her hands around a mug of tea. Glen approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so sorry. Beth looks up at him despairingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do they... suspect anyone? I mean of like Foul Play?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was my fault. I let the dog go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, no...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I shooed him away! The police said it was an accident but...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't your fault! BETH What I don't understand is why was he in that field anyway? He hated cows. And when they were coming, why didn't he get out of their way?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beth. I have to tell you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .10.09 110-111. For a moment, confession and silence hang in the balance. Glen opens his mouth to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You live in the country. You share it with those dangerous beasts. And when they're scared, they run. Like we do... Glen is full of horror at his lie. But Beth is only grateful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glen. Stay with me. Her eyes, still red with grief, are full of their future together. Glen nods. He will stay. He wants it all. Beth leans into him, seeking comfort. He puts his arms around her, his face ashen with the weight of his secret. As he holds her, he looks around the room. Nicholas is everywhere, glaring down at him from photographs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . EVENING. WINNARDS FARM - THE GARDEN. 176 Tamara is in the garden, a strip on her nose. She sees Andy in the dusk. He's leaning against the gate watching her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't say anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kind of suits you. And I always did like the old one. They are in each others arms. The embrace lasts and lasts. Tamara is leading Andy up to the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did it on purpose, didn't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Made it so beautiful I'd never be able to leave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Been dying to get rid of you. This is my house. I was born in that room.
direction.name: direction
